text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast.com
[Music]
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 15 today's new
word is run into to run into or you can
say to run into something let's find out
what it means and how to use this phrase
in your daily conversation to run into
or to run into something well let's take
an example here I ran into some problems
so what does it mean
it basically means you meet some
problems or to start to have trouble
difficulty or some problems run into is
basically a phrasal verb many students
say I met some problems which is
completely wrong you should never say I
met some problems instead you should say
I ran into some problems or I ran into a
problem which is correct now let's
listen to some examples on how to use
this phrase in your daily conversation
example 1 John ran into some problems
with his project after he lost sponsors
[Music]
example till if you are not careful now
with your eating habits you can run into
a lot of problems later example 3 I ran
into some problem with my Xbox
Playstation
example four I ran into some problems
while installing updates for Windows XP
well if you install a pirated Windows XP
you will always run into some problems
[Music]
